locations.title: U1: Temple of Darkness
locations.about: Faction War [Adventure], p. 78
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 78.

NPC: Incarus, Vanuire, Ghargaross.

No powers are revered there, far below the Hive Ward: the name simply conveys its aura of fear and evil. A yagnoloth named Incarus serves as the “high priest” of the Temple. His servants include two nycaloth lieutenants (Vaniure and Ghargaross) and a large force of mezzoloth, piscoloth and canoloth underlings.

The Nightmare Shaft at the center of the temple allows the yugoloth to seep into the dreams of others.

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 45

locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 45
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80.

NPC: Traban, Trabanson, Tarholt, Tarholtson, Coal-Chewer.

A smithy near the Prison, run by the aging Traban and his kin, a family of dwarves (and one adopted ogre) from Krynn who specialize in some of the fanciest plate mail this side of Arcadia.

locations.title: ♀9: Interplanar Importers Merchant House & Restaurant
locations.about: The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 115
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 115.

NPC: Quin, Katya, Mikal, Strader.

  • Revolutionary League

locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 71
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 34

locations.description:

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 34
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80.

Headquarters of the Fraternity of Order, where they try criminal cases as both judges and advocates.

locations.title: ♀12: Singing Fountain
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 12
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 12.

NPC: Black Marian.

locations.title: ♀14: Vlrc’s Clocktower
locations.about: Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 51

Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 51.

NPC: Vlrc.

locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 14
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 14.

NPC: Bialla, Black Marian, “Sly” Nye.

locations.title: ♀16: City Barracks
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 92
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 92.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80.

Headquarters of the Harmonium, who patrol Sigil’s streets looking for lawbreakers, fugitives, Indeps, and other ne’er-do-wells.

locations.title: ♀17: Twelve Factol’s Restaurant & Tavern
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32.

A restaurant and tavern that resides underground, it’s a tiny slice of unexpectedly boisterous and messy life found nowhere else in The Lady’s Ward. Rumor has it the place includes a passage into the Catacombs where the dabus dwell.

locations.title: ♀22: Azure Iris Boarding House
locations.about:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 108
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 39
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 108.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 39.

NPC: Verden.

locations.title: ♀22: Fortune’s Wheel Gambling Hall
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 36
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 36.

A tavern and inn that appeals to the high rollers of Sigil. Finest food and drink, accompanied by a few rooms where plenty of gambling takes place, including the eponymous Wheel. Rooms in the inn are pricey but some of the most secure for rent in the Cage.

locations.title: ♀26: Prison
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 103
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 41
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 79
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 103.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 41.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 79.

Run by the Mercykillers, who take in everyone judged guilty in the City Court and handle their punishments.

locations.title: ♀27: Tower of the Wyrm
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 44
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 44.

Near the Prison, the Tower is run by the Mercykillers and houses the Wyrm, one of a special breed of wyvern. Its venom causes delirium and is used in truth potions, and the Red Death sometimes feed the condemned to the Wyrm.

locations.title: ♀28: Petitioner’s Square
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 21
locations.description: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 21.

locations.title: ♀38: Golden Bariaur Inn
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 39
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 78
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 39.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 78.

NPC: Goldenmane.

Near the Armory, this inn caters to Upper Planar clientele and those with a delicate or refined sensibility. Named after its doorman, a tawny bariaur named Goldenmane who looks like he had a leonal great-grandparent.

locations.title: ♀44: Armory
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 42
Faction War [Adventure], p. 57
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 42.
Faction War [Adventure], p. 57.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 32.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 80.

Home of the Doomguard, who manage the greatest concentration of magical weaponry in the city (and some say the planes). Right along the fuzzy border between The Lady’s Ward and the Lower Ward.

locations.title: ♀50: Temple of the Abyss
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 43
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 43.

NPC: Noshteroth of the Umber Scales.

The Temple stands in honor of all the Abyssal Lords, and houses the best-known and most reliable portal to the Abyss. It’s a dark, horrible place that’s tolerated because it can get things done, and discreetly. The current high priest is Noshteroth of the Umber Scales, who is guarded by a retinue of powerful tanar’ri.

locations.title: ♀54: Great Library
locations.about:
Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], pp. 27, 37
Faction War [Adventure], p. 84
Hellbound: The Blood War [Boxed Set] — War Games, p. 42
locations.description:
Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], pp. 27, 37.
Faction War [Adventure], p. 84.
Hellbound: The Blood War [Boxed Set] — War Games, p. 42.

NPC: Goldfeather, Androcyn Blackthorn, Shactal.

This city-sponcored facility is run by the dabus themselves, who spend most of their time making sure that clerks from faction libraries don’t walk off with valuable books or stuff the shelves with smuggled propaganda. The Great Library tries to assert its independence — a body won’t find much regarding the faction beliefs or organizations here.

locations.title: ♀57: Screaming Tower
locations.about: Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47
locations.description:
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47.

NPC: Zaraga, Eyarq, Baagoth, Glirkhil, Pix, Pox, Pux.

The 250’ tall twisted and hollow structure was built atop a natural portal leading to the Elemental Plane of Air. Every hour a huge gust of wind erupts from the portal and blows through the holes, creating the painful wailing noise which earns the tower its name.

  • Gargoyles

locations.title: ♀59: Tower of the Prophet
locations.about: Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], p. 23
locations.description:
Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], p. 23.

NPC: Humbart, Edelbart, Ursival, Brizsli, Grenata, Justus & Lucinor.

locations.title: M0: The Great Bazaar
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96.

A grand plaza that is home to a sprawling, vibrant market that never closes, the Bazaar is also the home turf of the Free League. The Indeps and the rules of commerce make sure that the deals are fair and honest — well, mostly. Caveat emptor.

locations.title: M2: S&J Transport
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 82
locations.description: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 82.

locations.title: M4: Wooly Cupgrass’ Laboratory
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 22
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 22.

NPC: Wooly Cupgrass.

Alchemist’s lab whose proprietor can identify nearly any liquid, magical or not.

locations.title: M9: Bronze Bezants Loanshop
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 90
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 90.

NPC: F. Moskin Faz.

A rigorously honest loan agency but with standards to match.

locations.title: M13: Red Lion Inn
locations.about: The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 84
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 84.

NPC: Jadex, Bria Tomay, Lethea & Lesander.

locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 36
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 36.

NPC: Fell, Milori.

Studio run by a disgraced dabus, whose tattoos can come to life at the most opportune (or inopportune) moments.

Dragon Magazine #414, p. 2.

NPC: Alluvius Ruskin.

This store is in a tower with green marble walls. It is known as good place to buy portal keys and is run by Alluvius Ruskin, a tiefling, old and frail.

locations.title: M23: Chirper’s Inn
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 93
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 93.

A sprawling inn that doubles as tourist trap, anyone is welcome as long as they keep the peace and have money to spend. A variety of attractions and small specialty shops are built into the building, including a small theater and a display of exotic creatures’ skulls.

locations.title: M24: Café Leonan
locations.about: Blood Wars Trilogy 1: Blood Hostages [Novel], p. 65
locations.description:
Blood Wars Trilogy 1: Blood Hostages [Novel], p. 65.

NPC: Leonan, Jandau, LiGrun, Boffo, Artus, Aereas, Ninavereth.

locations.about:
Finder’s Bane [Novel], p. 267
Defunct
locations.description:
Finder’s Bane [Novel], p. 267.

Beneath Dits’ Books on Copperman Way.

  • Defunct

locations.title: G6: Talun Underfoot’s Burrow
locations.about: Faction War [Adventure], p. 19
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 19.

NPC: Talun Underfoot.

Talun Underfoot, a wealthy halfling from Oerth, commisioned an actual burrow to be dug for him in the artificial hill that was created from a few tons of real Oerthian soil.

locations.title: G8: Ensin’s Discount Elixirs
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 95
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 95.

NPC: Ensin.

A potion shop run by the wizard Ensin who cuts corners to produce cheap, weak potions in mass quantities.

locations.title: G11: Great Gymnasium
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 145
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 88
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 145.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 96.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 88.

Run by the Transcendant Order, the Gymnasium is to health and relaxation as the Festhall is to entertainment. It also serves as the most neutral of neutral grounds in the city, where even aasimon and tanar’ri can meet in peace.

locations.title: G13: Harim Festhall
locations.about: The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 116
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 116.

NPC: Cassandra, Nanice, Traice.

  • Revolutionary League

locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 87.

NPC: Ustisha Cambris.

locations.title: G16: Dark House of Divination
locations.about: Faction War [Adventure], p. 66
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 66.

NPC: Thuemos Diaret.

locations.title: G17: The Other Place Spa
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 46
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 46.

NPC: Iarmid, Laenis, Autochon the Bellringer.

A luxurious spa across the street from the Great Gymnasium, with a reputation unsurpassed outside the Upper Planes.

locations.title: G28: Zakk’s Corpse Curing Taxidermy Shop
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 99
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 99.

NPC: Mhasha Zakk.

Home to the best taxidermist in the Cage, Mhasha Zakk.

locations.title: G29: Boffo’s Music Shop
locations.about: Blood Wars Trilogy 1: Blood Hostages [Novel], p. 25
locations.description:
Blood Wars Trilogy 1: Blood Hostages [Novel], p. 25.

Location: Guildhall Ward.
NPC: Boffo, Artus, Aereas, Ninavereth.

locations.title: C1: Trianym
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 78
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 78.

NPC: Sura Ekness, Cirily.

A public forum moderated by Sura Ekness, with daily debates on a variety of topics. Anyone may participate with Sura’s approval, and a good showing can lead to an invitation to the Hall of Speakers.

locations.title: C2: Trioptic Nic’Epona Statue
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 79
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 79.

A gargantuan statue of a three-eyed nic’Epona (a magical sort of horse). The base of the statue holds three portals to the Prime, Elysium, and Celestia. It is guarded by a hired band of Doomguard.

locations.title: C4: Hall of Speakers
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 124
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 72
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 124.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 72.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86.

Run by the Sign of One, the high-level business of running Sigil’s government is handled here as representatives of the factions gather to debate and enact legislation, as well as set more unofficial policy.

locations.title: C8: Tome of Magic Components Shop
locations.about: Doors to the Unknown [Adventure], p. 25
locations.description:
Doors to the Unknown [Adventure], p. 25.

NPC: Chelsy Darkhair.

locations.title: C9: Scribe’s Rest Pub
locations.about: Doors to the Unknown [Adventure], p. 26
locations.description:
Doors to the Unknown [Adventure], p. 26.

NPC: Hofften Burrfoot.

locations.title: C15: Jeena Ealy’s Compound
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 72
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 72.

Home to the retired explorer and writer Jeena Ealy, who has a series of best-selling books about life in some of the most unpleasant parts of the planes. Due to advancing age, she now hires adventurers to gather the chant for her.

locations.title: C16: Cup of Freedom Library
locations.about: Something Wild [Adventure], p. 17
locations.description:
Something Wild [Adventure], p. 17.

NPC: Fiery Polk.

  • Revolutionary League

locations.title: C18: Tensar’s Employment Service
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 77
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 77.

This service connects people with jobs across Sigil, but has very high standards. Run personally by Utadas Tensar.

locations.title: C25: Civic Festhall
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 134
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 84
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 134.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 84.

The place to go for an evening’s entertainment, where one can find almost any kind of performance, art exhibition, of show at all hours of the day and night, all courtesy of the Society of Sensation.

locations.title: C28: Greengage Cider Shop
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86.

NPC: Marda Farambler.

A tavern that caters to the smaller races, specializing in cider from the orchards of the halfling goddess Sheela Peryroyl.

locations.title: C30: Milori the Translator
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 64
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 64.

NPC: Milori.

Home of the Fated, who run Sigil’s Mint and keep records of everything the city needs to keep an eye on, from deeds of ownership to the census to tax rolls.

locations.title: C40: Hall of Information
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 66
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 66.

NPC: Bordon Mok, Brot the Mad, Erlik, Cwalno.

Run as an adjunct to the Hall of Records, the Hall is run to assist anyone (for a fee) who needs to deal with Sigil’s civil service.

locations.title: C42: Whole Note Inn
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, pp. 61, 62
locations.description: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, pp. 61, 62.

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 63.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 86.

NPC: Grundlethum Blackdagger.

A wizard’s shop that uses a bound elemental spirit to produce high-quality documents for mass dissemination at a fraction of the time and cost of any other scribe.

locations.title: H0: The Hive
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 113
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 84
Faction War [Adventure], p. 26

Faction War [Adventure], p. 26.

The mad, tangled mess at the heart of the Ward, and also the shanty-town home of the Xaositects, who bring madness, wonders, and atrocities to the city all in their quest for chaos.

locations.title: H12: Mortuary
locations.about:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 18

Planescape: Torment [PC Game].

NPC: Skall, Komosahl Trevant.

Run by the Dustmen, who dispose of most every dead body that turns up unclaimed around the Cage.

locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 31
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111
Faction War [Adventure], p. 98

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111.
Faction War [Adventure], p. 98.

Managed by the Bleak Cabal, the Gatehouse Asylum is packed near to bursting with countless people broken by the planes or life.

Pages of Pain [Novel], p. 50.

NPC: Brill, Jayk, Theseus, Ariadne.

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 83
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 83.

NPC: Retzz.

Never quite in the same place every night, the Night Market is where you can go to buy or sell anything across the city, especially anything stolen or illegal.

locations.title: H17: Quake’s Place Tavern
locations.about: The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 155
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 155.

NPC: Quake Lavender.

  • Xaositects

locations.title: H18: Bottle & Jug Tavern
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 107
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 107.

NPC: Barl Hoxun, Akra.

A foreboding, fortress-like tavern staffed largely by fensir. It’s an open secret that the proprietor, Barl Hoxun runs a vicious boxing arena behind closed doors.

locations.title: H20: Parakk the Ratcatcher’s Case
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 76
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 76.

NPC: Parakk the Ratcatcher, the Us.

locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 68.

NPC: Bonebloom, Morvun, Phineas.

locations.title: H23: Ylem’s Tower
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, pp. 78, 116
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, pp. 78, 116.

NPC: Ylem, Patch, Rule-of-Three.

locations.title: H24: Allesha’s Pantry
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 106
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 106.

NPC: Allesha Sheevis.

The best known and best funded of a handful of charity kitchens in the Hive, run by Allesha Sheevis. Nobody is turned away, and the food is free. The place also puts up those who are willing to donate a little work each day, or drop a coin in the donation box.

locations.title: H25: Green Stone Stables
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 111.

NPC: Bismen Yscoppel.

Mounts to rent or purchase, though their quality is rather dubious.

locations.title: H31: Weary Spirit Infirmary
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 121
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 121.

NPC: Ridnir Tetch.

A free hospital for those with a death wish. The healers shun magical methods and freely experiment in “radical” new surgical techniques on anyone who can be baited in with the promise of a bed and meal.

locations.title: H39: The Slags
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 115
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 116.

A scar on the already hideous Hive, a neighborhood that was destroyed in a sudden intrusion of the Blood War into the city centuries if not millennia ago. Something taints the place ever since, making any attempt at rebuilding futile.

locations.title: H44: Slaughterhouse Tavern
locations.about: Dungeon Magazine #60, pp. 32-58
locations.description:
Dungeon Magazine #60, pp. 32-58.

NPC: Graxagal, Vaargh, Snurz, Bhalog, Turia, Zilbog, Rule-of-Three.

locations.title: L1: Friendly Fiend Magic Shop
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 8
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 8.

NPC: A’kin, Balaka.

Magical trinkets and curio shop run by the mysterious but disarmingly polite yugoloth A’kin.

locations.title: L3: The Golden Bell Pawnshop
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 50
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 50.

NPC: Marisha the Fox, Pincher the Exile, Crookshank.

Near The Lady’s Ward, this pawn shop trades in damn near everything. It’s run by an alu-fiend fence and her human husband.

locations.title: L5: Harbinger House
locations.about:
Harbinger House [Adventure], p. 46
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55
locations.description:
Harbinger House [Adventure], p. 46.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55.

A tiny asylum run by the Believers of the Source, for reasons unknown. It contains many who are too crazy for the Prison and too dangerous for the Gatehouse Asylum.

locations.title: L8: Society of the Luminiferous Aether
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55.

NPC: Gamnesto the Vile.

A working mage’s gentleman’s club, with access only for members and their guests. Very exclusive, and expensive to join. Its entrance is guarded by a gehreleth, Gamnesto the Vile.

locations.title: L10: Black Sail Tavern & Inn
locations.about:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 16
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47
locations.description:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 16.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48.
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47.

NPC: Zaren, Salja, Horrn, Inimigle, Turia.

A quiet tavern frequented by craftsmen who work near the Armory and the border to The Lady’s Ward. Built from the remnants of an ancient galleon, though none know how it ended up in Sigil.

locations.title: L14: Great Foundry
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 20
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 50
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 81
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 20.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 50.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 81.

Headquarters of the Believers of the Source, where they produce countless common iron goods used citywide.

locations.title: L16: Styx Oarsman Bar
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 56
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 85
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 82
Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], p. 19

In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 56.
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 85.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 82.
Expedition to the Demonweb Pits [Adventure], p. 19.

NPC: Rule-of-Three, Zegonz Vlaric, Marilith, Gryfalcon.

A tavern that caters to fiends, particularly the tanar’ri. It’s possible for non-fiends to bribe their way in, but ill-advised.

locations.title: L25: Parted Veil Bookshop
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 16
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 16.

NPC: Kesto Brighteyes, Sir Cleve, Jeena Ealy, “Sly” Nye.

A cramped, overstuffed bookstore where one can find almost any title as has been written.

locations.title: L26: Temple of Lost Badir
locations.about: Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 148
locations.description:
Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 148.

NPC: Ghear the Sighted, Argesh Fiord, Kank.

locations.title: L27: Hands of Time Clockwork Shop/Guildhall
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 51
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 51.

NPC: Saddam Hasan Ibn Arvalas.

A shop that specializes in anything with moving parts, and itself is a constantly shifting mechanical sculpture. It’s run by a strange mix of modrons, aasimon, dwarves, and gnomes, and is almost a guild in itself. Managed by Saddam Hasan ibn Arvalas, originally from Toril.

locations.title: L37: Bones of the Night
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48.

NPC: Lothar the Old.

Near the Ditch, this place is managed by Lothar the Old, Master of the Bones, who steals secrets from the bones of the dead and trades information to his own inscrutable ends.

locations.title: L38: Shattered Temple
locations.about:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 10
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 82
locations.description:
The Factol’s Manifesto, p. 10.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55.
Planescape Campaign Setting [Boxed set] — Sigil and Beyond, p. 82.

Home of the Athar, considered ill-omened by most after the Lady laid waste to the&nsbp;neighborhood centuries ago on the night she slew Aoskar, the God of Portals.

locations.title: L43: Court of Woe
locations.about: Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 40
locations.description:
Uncaged: Faces of Sigil, p. 40.

NPC: Judge Gabberslug, Lord Porpen, Wrinkled Dannoch, “Sly” Nye.

A private court managed by the Dustmen and presided over by a nalfeshnee, which takes spillover cases from the City Court.

locations.title: L46: Green Mill Tavern
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 51
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 51.

A beautiful tavern that caters mostly to elves and sylvan clients, but is popular among Primes and clients from The Lady’s Ward. The mill really works and elven breads are produced fresh daily.

locations.title: L51: The Ditch
locations.about: In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 49
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 49.

A stinking mire of a canal that marks the border between the Lower Ward and the Hive Ward, favored dumping ground for deaders where even the Dustmen or corpse-pickers are reluctant to go trawling.

locations.title: L55: The Wound That Bleeds Monument
locations.about:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 123
Post Faction War
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 123.

Location: Lower Ward.

locations.title: L57: Zactar Cathedral
locations.about: Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47
locations.description:
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47.

Monstrous church, once the headquarters of the Zactars. Most locals beleive that the cathedral is cursed.

NPC: Inimigle, Kraal, Chypp, Leerie, Rockjaws, Kiria, Ivadi, Jerezin.

locations.title: A3: World Serpent Inn
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 57
Dragon Magazine #351, pp. 20-28
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 55.
Dragon Magazine #351, pp. 20-28.

NPC: Mitchifer, Akim al-Kalaas, Chch’kraran, Kraksha of Khorvaire, Mellomir of Arabel, Phoebus, The Bearded Reaver.

The World Serpent Inn is both a place and a nonplace, existing in multiple planes simultaneously and nowhere at all.

The Inn’s main entrance is a two-way portal, though its destination changes frequently. Usually it takes on an appearance appropriate for its surroundings, such as a never-beforenoticed storefront in town, a roadside tavern conveniently placed to provide shelter from a storm, or a cavern revealed by a rockslide.

The portal, regardless of its appearance, is always marked with the symbol of a serpent curled into a horizontal figure eight (the sign of infinity), eating its own tail.

  • Primes
